solution_line_template: Polly circled the one-quarter mile track {polly_circuits} times in {polly_time_hours} hours at a speed of {polly_circuits}/{polly_time_hours}={polly_circuits_per_hour} circuits of the track per hour.

Gerald traveled at a speed half of what Polly traveled for an average speed of {polly_speed_mph}/{gerald_speed_divisor}=<<{polly_speed_mph}/{gerald_speed_divisor}={gerald_speed_mph}>>{gerald_speed_mph} miles per hour.
